text: <https://eprint.iacr.org/2021/232> A new paper has just been released that claims to break RSA by dramatically speeding up integer factorization. Massive news if true

elements.text: A new paper has just been released that claims to break RSA by dramatically speeding up integer factorization. Massive news if true

text: isn't destroying RSA a pretty bad news, if true?

elements.text: isn't destroying RSA a pretty bad news, if true?

text: It will probably have some terrible effects.

elements.text: It will probably have some terrible effects.

text: It would be really bad. Most of the internet has switched to elliptic curve methods, but RSA and other methods involving factoring integers are still used for a lot (including HTTPS certificate verification)

elements.text: It would be really bad. Most of the internet has switched to elliptic curve methods, but RSA and other methods involving factoring integers are still used for a lot (including HTTPS certificate verification)

text:
from Wikipedia

> None of these papers considers factorization of integers larger than 800-bit, when the public experimental record is 829-bit,[4] and 1024-bit RSA is widely considered obsolete.

elements.text: None of these papers considers factorization of integers larger than 800-bit, when the public experimental record is 829-bit,[4] and 1024-bit RSA is widely considered obsolete.

text: yeah. 2048 bit and 4096 bit are the types most frequently used.

elements.text: yeah. 2048 bit and 4096 bit are the types most frequently used.

text: that said depending on how well this technique scales (and if it works at all), it might put 2048 bit within reach for nation states

elements.text: that said depending on how well this technique scales (and if it works at all), it might put 2048 bit within reach for nation states

text: Still the algorithm is 10^13 times faster

elements.text: Still the algorithm is 10^13 times faster

text: and if someone makes an advance on it - then eeek

elements.text: and if someone makes an advance on it - then eeek

text: somebody who has time should implement it in Julia and see if it's faster

elements.text: somebody who has time should implement it in Julia and see if it's faster

text: If it works, it would made a great PR for `Primes.jl`

attachments.title: Does Schnorr's 2021 factoring method show that the RSA cryptosystem is not secure?
attachments.text: Claus Peter Schnorr recently posted a 12-page factoring method by SVP algorithms. Is it correct? It says that the algorithm factors integers $N \approx 2^{400}$ and $N \approx 2^{800}$ by $4.2 \cdo...
attachments.fallback: Cryptography Stack Exchange: Does Schnorr's 2021 factoring method show that the RSA cryptosystem is not secure?
